p: Ginger ( Zingiber officinale) is a popular ingredient in cooking, and especially in Asian and Indian cuisine. It has also been used for many centuries for medicinal purposes. Possible health benefits include relieving nausea, loss of appetite, motion sickness, pain and inflammation ( Mao etÂ al., 2019). Ginger is high in dietary fiber, iron, vitamin C and potassium ( Ware and Weatherspoon 2017). In 2017, global production of ginger was 3.0 million tons. Top ginger producing in million tons are countries India 1.1, China 0.6, Nigeria 0.4, Nepal 0.3, Indonesia 0.2 ( Factfish Statistics World Ginger Production 2017).
